abstract: A consensus is emerging that decades of suppression of small fires is a leading cause of the recent huge destructive ones.
snippet: A consensus is emerging that decades of suppression of small fires is a leading cause of the recent huge destructive ones.
lead_paragraph: Jim Pitts stood on a Forest Service road near the Arizona town of Nutrioso and surveyed the damage in the valley below. It was July, and only a few weeks earlier the Wallow Fire, the largest in recorded history in Arizona, had swept through this section of steep slopes and tightly packed trees.

headline.main: Chopping Down Trees to Save Forests
